ceterms:description: Students applying for undergraduate admission in an associate (AA) program must provide the following:
ceterms:name: Brandman University - Undergraduate Admission for Associate's Program

ceterms:condition: High school diploma or GED equivalent
Official high school transcript indicating the date of graduation
High school cumulative GPA of 2.0
Pass admissions test in English and Math
Successful completion of a transferable course to ENGU-103 or ENGU-104 (grade of C or higher) waives admissions test in English
Successful completion of a transferable course to MATU-103 or higher (grade of C or higher) waives admissions test in Math
ceterms:requires.ceterms:description: Students applying for undergraduate admission in an associate (AA) program with 0 - 11 transferable credits must provide the following:
ceterms:requires.ceterms:name: Brandman University - Undergraduate Admission in an Associate Program - 0 - 11 transferable credits:

ceterms:condition: Provide official transcripts from ALL colleges and universities attended. No admission exams or high school transcript are required.
ceterms:requires.ceterms:description: Students applying for undergraduate admission in an associate (AA) program with 12 or more transferable credits must provide the following:
ceterms:requires.ceterms:name: Brandman University - Undergraduate Admission in an Associate Program - 12 or more transferable credits:

ceterms:description: First-Year Application: Elon’s first-year undergraduate application is online only. A credit card is required when you apply unless you have been issued a fee waiver.
ceterms:name: Elon University Admission Requirements

ceterms:condition: English: 4 units required (3 units must be completed for admissions consideration)
Math: 3 units required (Algebra I, Algebra II and Geometry), 4 recommended
Science: 3 or more units, including at least one lab science
Social Studies: 3 or more units, including U.S. History
Foreign Language: 2 units required, 3 recommended (Students who have not completed at least two units in one foreign language must complete a 121-level foreign language course at Elon.)
ceterms:recommends.ceterms:description: Applicants are encouraged to pursue the following throughout their four years of high school.
ceterms:recommends.ceterms:name: Applicant Recommendations

ceterms:description: We need to determine your reading, writing and math skills in order to make sure your classes are the right fit for you. We can measure this in several different ways, including previous college credit you've earned, SAT/PSAT or ACT scores, high school GPA or through an assessment tool called Accuplacer! If you have test scores or transcripts to send, you can upload them when you apply. If you don't have them when you complete the application, don't worry!
ceterms:name: Ivy Tech Admission Requirements

ceterms:requires.ceterms:description: The only general requirement is a high school diploma.
ceterms:requires.ceterms:name: High School Diploma

ceterms:description: To apply for graduate admission, you must fulfill one of the following admission options. In addition, specific program admission requirements must also be met.
ceterms:name: Brandman University - Graduate Admission

ceterms:condition: A 3.0 GPA calculated over the most recent 30 graded semester (45 quarter) credits completed in either a baccalaureate or post baccalaureate program, including credits earned toward a credential.
ceterms:requires.ceterms:description: Requirements include: a 3.0 GPA calculated over the most recent 30 graded semesters  and  for a Master Degree Level
ceterms:requires.ceterms:name: Brandman University - Graduate Admission - Option One

ceterms:condition: A GPA between 2.5 - 2.99 (MAE/MAT requires 2.75-2.99) calculated over the most recent graded 30 semester (45 quarter) credits completed in either a baccalaureate or post baccalaureate program, including credits earned toward a credential
A satisfactory score on an accepted graduate admissions exam (GRE, GMAT, CSET, or MAT)
ceterms:requires.ceterms:description: Requirements include a GPA between 2.5 - 2.99  and capability at a Master Degree level
ceterms:requires.ceterms:name: Brandman University - Graduate Admission - Option Two

ceterms:condition: An earned master's degree or higher from a regionally accredited institution
ceterms:requires.ceterms:description: Requirements include an earned master's degree or higher from a regionally accredited institution
ceterms:requires.ceterms:name: Brandman University - Graduate Admission - Option Three

ceterms:condition: Writing samples that show graduate level communication and analytical skills
Detailed resume showing professional development, achievements, awards, and professional recognition
Letters of reference from persons who can attest to the applicant’s ability to do graduate level work
Letter of explanation detailing the reasons the student believes he or she is a good candidate for graduate study in the discipline requested
ceterms:requires.ceterms:description: Submission of a portfolio of evidence that shows adequate preparation for graduate studies. The portfolio will contain the following:
ceterms:requires.ceterms:name: Brandman University - Graduate Admission - Option Four

ceterms:description:
Admission to Saddleback College is open to anyone who is a high school graduate, has a high school equivalency certificate, or is 18 years of age and shows evidence of being able to benefit from instruction.

Students enrolled in K-12 may attend as Special Admits. Please see the High School and K-8 Students page for more details.
ceterms:name: Admissions

ceterms:description:
ASU welcomes applications from students with diverse academic backgrounds and interests. A freshman is defined as a student who has graduated from a regionally accredited high school and has completed fewer than 12 transferable college credits post-high school. Freshman applicants who possess a high school diploma and meet the following requirements will be admitted to ASU.

English - 4 years (composition/literature based)
Math - 4 years (algebra I, geometry, algebra II and one course requiring algebra II as a prerequisite)
Laboratory Science - 3 years total (1 year each from any of the following areas are accepted: biology, chemistry, earth science, integrated sciences and physics)
Social Science - 2 years (including 1 year American history)
Second Language - 2 years (same language)
Fine Arts or Career and Technical Education - 1 year
Applicants must also meet at least one of the following:
Top 25% in high school graduating class
3.00 GPA in competency courses (4.00 = "A")
ACT 22 (24 nonresidents)*
SAT
Taken prior to May 2016: 1040 (1110 nonresidents)
Taken after April 2016: 1120 (1180 nonresidents)*
ceterms:name: ASU Admissions Requirements

ceterms:condition: English - 4 years (composition/literature based)
Math - 4 years (algebra I, geometry, algebra II and one course requiring algebra II as a prerequisite)
Laboratory Science - 3 years total (1 year each from any of the following areas are accepted: biology, chemistry, earth science, integrated sciences and physics)
Social Science - 2 years (including 1 year American history)
Second Language - 2 years (same language)
Fine Arts or Career and Technical Education - 1 year
ceterms:requires.ceterms:description: Requires include High school diploma and required subjects.
ceterms:requires.ceterms:name: High School Diploma

ceterms:description: Apply for free using our Online Application. Be sure to choose the appropriate application. After you apply, we will send an email with your login information to My Cougar Connection.  You can use this information to check on the status of your application, pay your confimation fee online, and much more!
ceterms:name: Undergraduate Admissions

ceterms:description: Students applying for undergraduate admission in a bachelor's program must have:
ceterms:name: Brandman University - Undergraduate Admission for Bachelor's Program

ceterms:condition: At least 12 transferable baccalaureate-level credits (or the equivalent) from a regionally accredited college or university.
A minimum 2.0 cumulative GPA in all prior college-level coursework.
ceterms:requires.ceterms:description: Students applying for undergraduate admission in a bachelor's program must have:
ceterms:requires.ceterms:name: Brandman University - Undergraduate Requirements - Bachelor's Program
